articles.title: Scenes from TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.content: Thanks to everyone who made this year's San Francisco event what it was -- and to the 10,000 of you who filled the halls, made the connections, and left with more than you came with. Couldn't make it? These images tell part of the story.

articles.title: Navan IPO tumbles 20% after historic debut under SEC shutdown workaround
articles.content: Navan finished its first day trading at an approximate valuation of $4.7 billion, which is about half of its last private valuation of $9.2 billion.

articles.title: Nvidia is reportedly investing up to $1B in Poolside
articles.content: Nvidia is an existing investor in the AI company and participated in its $500 million Series A round in 2024.

articles.title: Canva launches its own design model, adds new AI features to the platform
articles.content: Canva is launching new features like Forms and email design, and it makes Affinity free for all users.

articles.title: Bevel raises $10M Series A from General Catalyst for its AI health companion
articles.content: Bevel's AI health companion unifies data from wearables and daily habits across sleep, fitness, and nutrition into personalized insights.

articles.title: Threads now lets you approve and filter your replies
articles.content: While Threads already offers tools that let you limit replies to people you follow, your followers, or people you mention, the new feature allows you to keep your replies open to all without the negative consequences of having discussions derailed.

articles.title: Google partners with Ambani’s Reliance to offer free AI Pro access to millions of Jio users in India
articles.content: U.S. tech giants increasingly view India as the next big frontier — a place to gather diverse data, refine models, and test AI use cases that could later scale across other emerging markets.

articles.title: Figma acquires AI-powered media generation company Weavy
articles.content: Figma said that Weavy will exist as a stand-alone product for now and that, in the future, it will be integrated with the Figma Weave brand, along with the rest of the Figma platform.

articles.title: The Prompting Company snags $6.5M to help products get mentioned in ChatGPT and other AI apps
articles.content: Retailers could see up to a 520% increase in traffic from chatbots and AI prompts in 2025 compared to 2024, according to the report. For brands, that means figuring out how to show up in AI-generated recommendations, and fast.

articles.title: WhatsApp adds passkey protection to end-to-end encrypted backups
articles.content: This means if you lose your device, you can use methods like fingerprint, face, or the screen lock code of your previous device to access WhatsApp's backup.

articles.title: IntrCity SmartBus lands $30M at $140M valuation to deepen its grip on India’s intercity travel market
articles.content: IntrCity SmartBus grew revenue by 67% last year and is targeting full profitability this year, as intercity travel booms across India.

articles.title: India’s Snabbit valuation doubled to $180M in 5 months on its quick house-help bet
articles.content: India's appetite for instant convenience — once confined to food and grocery delivery — is expanding into house help.

articles.title: Cluely’s Roy Lee on the rage-bait strategy for startup marketing
articles.content: Cluely's Roy Lee has a message for startup founders: You should be thinking harder about how to go viral.

articles.title: NBA champion Tristan Thompson and World Mobile launch community-owned network Uplift
articles.content: With Uplift, every subscription will contribute to neighborhood-level network expansion, while local hosts that are known as "AirNode operators" will earn a portion of network revenue by providing community coverage.

articles.title: Digg founder Kevin Rose on the need for trusted social communities in the AI era
articles.content: Now again under Rose's control, the new Digg is creating a place for people to socialize and connect online within communities, similar to Reddit, but it has different ideas about how such a platform should work at a time when bots are nearly indistinguishable from humans.

articles.title: YouTube announces ‘voluntary exit program’ for US staff
articles.content: YouTube CEO Neal Mohan told employees about the program via an internal memo on Wednesday.

articles.title: And the winner of Startup Battlefield at Disrupt 2025 is: Glīd
articles.content: Glīd, which is trying to streamline cargo container logistics, has beaten out 199 other Startup Battlefield companies to take home $100,000.

articles.title: Solana co-founder Anatoly Yakovenko is a big fan of agentic coding
articles.content: Speaking at TechCrunch Disrupt, Yakovenko said he's become increasingly comfortable taking a back seat in software development tasks.

articles.title: 2024’s Startup Battlefield runner-up geCKo Materials reveals four new products at TechCrunch Disrupt
articles.content: geCKo Materials returned to the stage at TechCrunch Disrupt to debut new products as it pushes deeper into commercializing its tech.

articles.title: Box CEO Aaron Levie on how AI is changing the enterprise SaaS landscape
articles.content: He painted a picture of a future of enterprise software where the SaaS is used for the core business workflow, and then the agents ride on top of that.

articles.title: Inside Meta’s 600-Person AI Layoff
articles.content: Meta is laying off roughly 600 employees from its Superintelligence Labs, the umbrella division overseeing its AI research and product development, according to an internal memo obtained by The New York Times.

articles.title: OpenAI Accused of Weakening Mental Health Safeguards in Wrongful Death Lawsuit
articles.content: OpenAI is facing a wrongful death lawsuit alleging the company intentionally weakened ChatGPT’s suicide prevention safeguards to boost user engagement, leading to the death of a 16-year-old.

articles.title: Amazon’s Plan to Replace 600,000 Workers With Robots Just Leaked
articles.content: Amazon, the second-largest private employer in the United States, is reportedly planning to automate a massive portion of its workforce during the next decade.

articles.title: Anthropic on Defense: The AI Lab Is Scrambling to Make Peace in Washington
articles.content: Anthropic, the AI lab known for its "safety-first" mission, appears to be in full defense mode. The company is now publicly scrambling to repair its relationship with the Trump administration after recent high-profile criticism.

articles.title: ChatGPT Atlas Is Facing Major Backlash Over Its Security Flaws
articles.content: OpenAI’s new ChatGPT Atlas browser is rolling out with powerful agentic features designed to read pages, click buttons, and carry out tasks on a user's behalf.

articles.title: Meet ChatGPT Atlas, OpenAI’s Agentic Web Browser
articles.content: OpenAI just officially launched ChatGPT Atlas, a new AI-powered web browser designed to weave automation, memory, and AI assistance directly into your everyday browsing.

articles.title: AI Godfathers, Steve Bannon, and Prince Harry Agree on One Thing: Stop Superintelligence
articles.content: A new open letter is urging a global prohibition on the development of superintelligence, and it's signed by one of the most unusual coalitions imaginable.
